title: The Dark Tower Book 8: Wind through the Keyhole
description:
In The Wind Through the Keyhole, Stephen King returns to the rich landscape of Mid-World, the spectacular territory of the Dark 

Tower fantasy saga that stands as his most beguiling achievement.
Roland Deschain and his ka-tetÃ¢â‚¬â€Jake, Susannah, Eddie, and Oy, the billy-bumblerÃ¢â‚¬â€encounter a ferocious storm just after crossing the 

River Whye on their way to the Outer Baronies. As they shelter from the howling gale, Roland tells his friends not just one strange 

story but two . . . and in so doing, casts new light on his own troubled past.

In his early days as a gunslinger, in the guilt-ridden year following his motherÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s death, Roland is sent by his father to 

investigate evidence of a murderous shape-shifter, a Ã¢â‚¬Å“skin-manÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ preying upon the population around Debaria. Roland takes charge of 

Bill Streeter, the brave but terrified boy who is the sole surviving witness to the beastÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s most recent slaughter. Only a teenager 

himself, Roland calms the boy and prepares him for the following dayÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s trials by reciting a story from the Magic Tales of the Eld 

that his mother often read to him at bedtime. Ã¢â‚¬Å“A personÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s never too old for stories,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ Roland says to Bill. Ã¢â‚¬Å“Man and boy, girl and 

woman, never too old. We live for them.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ And indeed, the tale that Roland unfolds, the legend of Tim Stoutheart, is a timeless 

treasure for all ages, a story that lives for us.

King began the Dark Tower series in 1974; it gained momentum in the 1980s; and he brought it to a thrilling conclusion when the last 

three novels were published in 2003 and 2004. The Wind Through the Keyhole is sure to fascinate avid fans of the Dark Tower epic. 

But this novel also stands on its own for all readers, an enchanting and haunting journey to RolandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s world and testimony to the 

power of Stephen KingÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s storytelling magic.
